phrase.original: Since its creation in 2012, the First Principles app has become a valuable asset for teaching the core principles of the faith. Whenever God's commands are accurately taught and obeyed, hearts are healed and the light of truth shines brighter. This app is intended to thoroughly equip every disciple of Jesus Christ in that mission.
Ask yourself, "What is the First Principles app worth, both to me and to others?"

It may already be obvious to you how valuable this app can be: the scriptures are instantly accessible, the audio instruction readily available. Its usefulness as a tool in making disciples has been shown. What if you could extend its use into communities that are even beyond your reach? What if your financial support could ensure that the app is making a difference, even while you yourself are resting?

As of January 1, 2021, the First Principles app will be transitioning to a paid subscription to help fund the McKean Scholarship Fund of MERCYworldwide. Your annual subscription will exclusively be used to support educational opportunities for children in third-world countries.
Consider the outcomes of obeying the following scriptures:
"Also, seek the peace and prosperity of the city to which I have carried you into exile. Pray to the LORD for it, because if it prospers, you too will prosper."

change.original: seek the peace and prosperity of the city to which I have carried you into exile.

phrase.original: In the above scripture, God commands the Israelites to seek the good of the cities where they will live in exile. But He also expects the same from modern-day Christians, who are likewise called "exiles" in the New Testament (Hebrews 11:13, 1 Peter 2:11). Thus God commands that His people seek the good of their secular community. And while this ultimately benefits all of us, it also inspires non-Christians to praise God:

change.original: God commands that His people seek the good of their secular community.

phrase.original: "You are the light of the world. A city on a hill cannot be hidden. Neither do people light a lamp and put it under a bowl. Instead they put it on its stand, and it gives light to everyone in the house. In the same way, let your light shine before men, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven."

phrase.original: So... do you consider this app (and these scripturally-promised outcomes) to be worth your financial support? If yes, then please become a subscriber!
